SENT.plain: The metabolism of bilirubin is a complicated process
Recently the genetic background of the conjugation of bilirubin is uncovered but the mechanism of bilirubin excretion in the liver and gut, and its toxic effects in the brain are largely unknown
The congenital defects in the bilirubin metabolism exists of four rare and one common disease
The clinical implications of these diseases vary but some are of great impact for the patient
The chronic character of these diseases requires an accurate management
It is to be expected that in the future new therapeutic strategies will be developed
